Overview of Provider

Source: vignettes/provider.Rmd
provider.Rmd
library(provider)


You Need to Find A Healthcare Provider Using Only Partial Information

So, you have to find healthcare provider using just partial information. For instance all you have is “EYE doctor RANIA in REDMOND”. Strictly speaking, it is necessary to perform a search with minimum information and the maximum level of relevance of the result. The second result in the list is “REDMOND EYE DOCTORS, PLLC” where Dr. Rania Montecillo specified an owner.


nppes_npi_new(city = "Redmond", 
              state = "WA", 
              first_name = "Rania") |> 
  tidyr::unnest(addresses) |> 
  dplyr::filter(last_name == "MONTECILLO")
#> # A tibble: 2 × 30
#>   npi       enume…¹ first…² last_…³ crede…⁴ sole_…⁵ gender enumerat…⁶ last_upd…⁷
#>   <chr>     <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  <date>     <date>    
#> 1 16593205… NPI-1   RANIA   MONTEC… od      NO      F      2006-05-09 2007-12-19
#> 2 16593205… NPI-1   RANIA   MONTEC… od      NO      F      2006-05-09 2007-12-19
#> # … with 21 more variables: status <chr>, name_prefix <chr>, middle_name <chr>,
#> #   name_suffix <chr>, taxonomies <list>, identifiers <list>, endpoints <list>,
#> #   other_names <list>, country_code <chr>, country_name <chr>,
#> #   address_purpose <chr>, address_type <chr>, address_1 <chr>,
#> #   address_2 <chr>, city <chr>, state <chr>, postal_code <chr>,
#> #   telephone_number <chr>, fax_number <chr>, practicelocations <list>,
#> #   enumeration_age <Duration>, and abbreviated variable names …



You Need to Find Detailed Healthcare Provider Information Using Known NPI Number

This is very common scenario. You need to get full replica of NPI record. Again, it simple. Just use code provided below. API response may contain single NPI record, or empty list in case NPI does not exist in the CMS National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) Registry.


nppes_npi_new(npi = 1285636522)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 19
#>   npi       enume…¹ organ…² organ…³ enumerat…⁴ last_upd…⁵ status autho…⁶ autho…⁷
#>   <chr>     <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 12856365… NPI-2   MEDSTA… NO      2005-06-01 2022-07-21 A      Stepha… Schnei…
#> # … with 10 more variables: authorized_official_telephone_number <chr>,
#> #   authorized_official_title_or_position <chr>,
#> #   authorized_official_name_prefix <chr>, taxonomies <list>,
#> #   identifiers <list>, endpoints <lgl>, other_names <lgl>, addresses <list>,
#> #   practicelocations <lgl>, enumeration_age <Duration>, and abbreviated
#> #   variable names ¹​enumeration_type, ²​organization_name,
#> #   ³​organizational_subpart, ⁴​enumeration_date, ⁵​last_updated, …



You Need to Lookup Multiple Healthcare Providers Using A List of NPI Numbers

You may need to perform bulk search for performance optimization. The “getcodes” operation allows you to decrease number of round trips in orders of magnitude. For instance you can get information about hundred NPI in one REST call, instead of sending NPI numbers one-by-one.


list <- c(1285636522, 1730198755, 1427145176)
list |> purrr::map_dfr(nppes_npi_new) 
#> # A tibble: 3 × 20
#>   npi       enume…¹ organ…² organ…³ enumerat…⁴ last_upd…⁵ status autho…⁶ autho…⁷
#>   <chr>     <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 12856365… NPI-2   MEDSTA… NO      2005-06-01 2022-07-21 A      Stepha… Schnei…
#> 2 17301987… NPI-2   MEDSTA… NO      2006-08-07 2010-03-12 A      Stepha… Schnei…
#> 3 14271451… NPI-2   MEDSTA… NO      2006-10-06 2012-10-09 A      Paul    Warda  
#> # … with 11 more variables: authorized_official_telephone_number <chr>,
#> #   authorized_official_title_or_position <chr>,
#> #   authorized_official_name_prefix <chr>, taxonomies <list>,
#> #   identifiers <list>, endpoints <lgl>, other_names <lgl>, addresses <list>,
#> #   practicelocations <lgl>, enumeration_age <Duration>,
#> #   authorized_official_middle_name <chr>, and abbreviated variable names
#> #   ¹​enumeration_type, ²​organization_name, ³​organizational_subpart, …



You Need to Check NPI Number Status

Again, very common scenario. You just need to check NPI number status. It is simple. Take a look at the code below. Expected result contains requested NPI number, status, and short status description.


nppes_npi_new(npi = 1285636522) |> 
  dplyr::select(npi, status)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   npi        status
#>   <chr>      <chr> 
#> 1 1285636522 A
nppes <- nppes_npi_new(npi = 1285636522)

nppes_type_npi <- nppes |> 
  dplyr::select(NPI = number, 
                enumeration_type) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(enumeration_type = dplyr::case_when(
    enumeration_type == "NPI-1" ~ "Individual", 
    enumeration_type == "NPI-2" ~ "Organization"))
#> Error in `dplyr::select()`:
#> ! Can't subset columns that don't exist.
#> ✖ Column `number` doesn't exist.

nppes_basic <- nppes$basic[[1]] |> 
  dplyr::rename_with(~ stringr::str_remove_all(.x, 
                              pattern = "basic_")) |> 
  dplyr::select(name_prefix, 
                first_name, 
                middle_name, 
                last_name, 
                credential, 
                gender, 
                enumeration_date, 
                certification_date, 
                last_updated) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(dplyr::contains("name"), 
                              stringr::str_to_title))
#> Error in UseMethod("rename_with"): no applicable method for 'rename_with' applied to an object of class "NULL"

nppes_tax <- nppes$taxonomies[[1]] |> 
  dplyr::select(code, 
                description = desc, 
                license)

nppes_add1 <- nppes$addresses[[1]] |> 
  dplyr::select(!c(address_purpose, 
                   address_1, 
                   address_type, 
                   country_code, 
                   country_name)) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(city = stringr::str_to_title(city),
                state = stringr::str_to_title(campfin::expand_state(state)),
                postal_code = campfin::normal_zip(postal_code),
                telephone_number = campfin::normal_phone(telephone_number),
                fax_number = campfin::normal_phone(fax_number)) |> 
  dplyr::distinct(telephone_number, .keep_all = TRUE)
#> Error in `dplyr::mutate()`:
#> ℹ In argument: `fax_number = campfin::normal_phone(fax_number)`.
#> Caused by error in `campfin::normal_phone()`:
#> ! object 'fax_number' not found

nppes_add2 <- nppes$addresses[[1]] |> 
  dplyr::select(address_purpose, 
                address_1) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(dplyr::everything(), 
                              stringr::str_to_title)) |> 
  tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = address_purpose, 
                     values_from = address_1, 
                     names_glue = "{address_purpose}_address") |> 
  dplyr::rename_with(tolower)

ord_ref <- order_refer(npi = 1114058443) |> 
  dplyr::select(Refer_to_Part_B = partb, 
                Refer_to_HHAs = hha, 
                Order_DME = dme, 
                Order_PMDs = pmd)

opt <- opt_out(npi = 1114058443) |> 
  dplyr::select(opt_out_effective_date = optout_effective_date, 
                opt_out_end_date = optout_end_date)
  

optex_final <- dplyr::bind_cols(nppes_type_npi, 
                                nppes_basic, 
                                nppes_add1, 
                                nppes_add2, 
                                nppes_tax, 
                                opt, 
                                ord_ref) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(dplyr::contains("date"), 
                              parsedate::parse_date)) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(practice_duration = lubridate::as.duration(
    lubridate::interval(enumeration_date, 
                        lubridate::today())),
                practice_length = as.numeric(practice_duration, 
                                             "years"),
                opt_out_duration = lubridate::as.duration(
                  lubridate::interval(opt_out_effective_date, 
                                      opt_out_end_date)),
                opt_out_length = as.numeric(opt_out_duration, 
                                            "years")) |> 
  dplyr::select(!c(practice_duration, 
                   opt_out_duration)) |> 
  dplyr::rename_with(~ stringr::str_replace_all(.x, 
                                                pattern = "_", 
                                                replacement = " ")) |>
  dplyr::rename_with(~ stringr::str_to_title(.x)) |> 
  dplyr::rename(NPI = Npi)
#> Error in list2(...): object 'nppes_type_npi' not found

optex_long <- optex_final |> 
  dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(dplyr::everything(), 
                              as.character)) |> 
  tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = dplyr::everything())
#> Error in dplyr::mutate(optex_final, dplyr::across(dplyr::everything(), : object 'optex_final' not found


#> Error in downloadthis::download_this(optex_long, output_name = "providercsv", : object 'optex_long' not found
#> Error in downloadthis::download_this(optex_long, output_name = "providerxlsx", : object 'optex_long' not found
#> Error in dplyr::group_vars(data): object 'optex_long' not found


eliz <- provider_enrollment(org_name = "ELIZABETHTOWN COMMUNITY HOSPITAL",
                            state = "NY",
                            prov_type_code = "00-85")
#> Error in provider_enrollment(org_name = "ELIZABETHTOWN COMMUNITY HOSPITAL", : unused argument (prov_type_code = "00-85")

eliz |> terse::terse()
#> Error in terse::terse(eliz): object 'eliz' not found
nppes <- tibble::tribble(
~fn,         ~params,
"nppes_npi", list(npi = eliz$npi[[1]]),
"nppes_npi", list(npi = eliz$npi[[2]]))
#> Error in list2(...): object 'eliz' not found

eliz2 <- purrr::invoke_map_dfr(nppes$fn, nppes$params)

eliz2 |> terse::terse()
#> Error in (function (..., na.rm = FALSE) : no arguments


Medicare Order and Referring API


Is the provider currently eligible to make referrals to Medicare Part B or a Home Health Agency (HHA)? Order Durable Medical Equipment (DME) or Power Mobility Devices (PMDs)? Search Medicare’s Order and Referring API with provider_moar():


order_refer(npi = 1083879860) |> 
  gt::gt() |> 
  provider:::gt_theme_provider() |> 
  gt::tab_header(title = "Provider Results for NPI 1083879860",
    subtitle = gtExtras::add_text_img("Report generated with", url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/andrewallenbruce/provider/main/pkgdown/favicon/apple-touch-icon-180x180.png", height = 25)) |> 
  gt::text_transform(locations = gt::cells_body(columns = c(partb, dme, hha, pmd)),
                     fn = function(x) {
                       if (x == as.character("TRUE")) {gt::html(fontawesome::fa("circle-check", prefer_type = "solid", fill = "green", height = "1.5em", width = "1.5em"))
                         } else if (x == as.character("FALSE")) {gt::html(fontawesome::fa("circle-xmark", prefer_type = "solid", fill = "red"))
                         }
                     }
                       )
Provider Results for NPI 1083879860
Report generated with
npi last_name first_name partb dme hha pmd
1083879860 AARON CHRISTOPHER


Medicare Provider and Supplier Taxonomy Crosswalk API


You may need to find Medicare’s specialty codes for this provider’s taxonomies. Using the output from the NPPES search in the first example, you can search Medicare’s Provider and Supplier Taxonomy Crosswalk API with taxonomy_crosswalk():


taxonomy_crosswalk(taxonomy_code = "282NC0060X") |> terse::terse()
#> $medicare_specialty_code                                           c1 A0[7] ...
#> $medicare_provider/supplier_type_description                       c1 Criti ...
#> $provider_taxonomy_code                                            c1 282NC ...
#> $provider_taxonomy_description:_type_classification_specialization c1 Hospi ...


Providers may need to update their digital contact information in the NPPES system. To check, you can access the CMS Public Reporting of Missing Digital Contact Information API with missing_information(). If they appear in the search results, it’s time to update their NPPES contact information:


missing_information(npi = 1114058443) |> terse::terse()
#> $npi        c1 1114058443
#> $last_name  c1 Smith     
#> $first_name c1 David     


opt_out(npi = 1114058443) |> terse::terse()
#> $first_name                  c1 David           
#> $last_name                   c1 Smith           
#> $npi                         c1 1114058443      
#> $specialty                   c1 Psychiatry      
#> $optout_effective_date       p1 2014-08-15      
#> $optout_end_date             p1 2024-08-15      
#> $first_line_street_address   c1 3101 STELLING DR
#> $second_line_street_address  c1 NA              
#> $city_name                   c1 PALO ALTO       
#> $state_code                  c1 CA              
#> $zip_code                    c1 943033960       
#> $eligible_to_order_and_refer l1 T               
#> $last_updated                p1 2023-01-16


Using physician_by_service(), you can access Medicare’s Physician & Other Practitioners - by Provider and Service API:


purrr::map_dfr(2013:2020, ~physician_by_service(npi = 1003000126, year = .x)) |> terse::terse()
#> $year         i8 2013      , 2014      , 2015      , 2016      , 2017       ...
#> $rndrng_npi   c8 1003000126, 1003000126, 1003000126, 1003000126, 1003000126 ...
#> $rndrng_prvdr L8 list(structure(list(rndrng_prvdr_last_org_name = c("Enkesh ...
#> $totals_srvcs L8 list(structure(list(tot_benes = c(138L, 95L, 47L, 381L, 10 ...
#> $hcpcs        L8 list(structure(list(hcpcs_cd = c("99222", "99223", "99231" ...
#> $averages     L8 list(structure(list(avg_sbmtd_chrg = c(368.62676056, 524.6 ...


This API contains data going back to 2013, so you can perform a long-term analysis of a provider’s Medicare data:


purrr::map_dfr(2013:2020, ~physician_by_service(npi = 1003000126, year = .x)) |> 
  dplyr::group_by(hcpcs_cd, hcpcs_desc) |> 
  dplyr::summarise(
    Beneficiaries = sum(tot_benes),
    Services = sum(tot_srvcs),
    Avg_Billed = janitor::round_half_up(mean(avg_sbmtd_chrg), digits = 2),
    Avg_Allowed = janitor::round_half_up(mean(avg_mdcr_alowd_amt), digits = 2),
    Avg_Payment = janitor::round_half_up(mean(avg_mdcr_pymt_amt), digits = 2)) |> 
  dplyr::ungroup() |> 
  dplyr::rename(HCPCS = hcpcs_cd, 
                Description = hcpcs_desc,
                "Avg Charge" = Avg_Billed,
                "Avg Allowed" = Avg_Allowed,
                "Avg Payment" = Avg_Payment) |> 
  dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(Services)) |> 
  gt::gt() |> 
  gtExtras::gt_add_divider(columns = "HCPCS", style = "dotted") |> 
  gtExtras::gt_merge_stack(col1 = HCPCS, 
                           col2 = Description,
                           small_cap = FALSE,
                           font_size = c("16px", "14px"),
                           font_weight = c("bold", "normal"),
                           palette = c("black", "darkgray")) |> 
  gt::tab_style(style = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#F54444"), 
                             gt::cell_text(color = "white", 
                                           weight = "bold")), 
                locations = gt::cells_row_groups()) |> 
  provider:::gt_theme_provider() |> 
  gt::tab_header(title = "Provider Results for NPI 1114058443",
  subtitle = gtExtras::add_text_img("Report generated with", 
  url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/andrewallenbruce/provider/main/pkgdown/favicon/apple-touch-icon-180x180.png", 
  height = 25))
#> Error in `dplyr::group_by()`:
#> ! Must group by variables found in `.data`.
#> Column `hcpcs_cd` is not found.
#> Column `hcpcs_desc` is not found.
